channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8309] TableLockManager: allow lock timeout to be set at the individual lock level
item.description:
Currently the lock timeout values and defaults are set and shared at the TableLockManager level.
One TableLockManager is shared on the master. We should allow the lock timeout to be set at individual lock level when we instantiate the lock. Components using the locks may have different timeout preferences.
item.summary: TableLockManager: allow lock timeout to be set at the individual lock level

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
+   * @param lock timeout

+   * @return A new TableLock object for acquiring a write lock

+   */

+  public abstract TableLock writeLock(byte[] tableName, String purpose, long timeout);

The correct way of referencing parameter in javadoc is to write parameter name after @param. In this case, timeout.

TableLockManager.java is marked Private. We can change its API. Would it be better if writeLock() always takes timeout parameter ? When say, value of -1 is passed, we use the default timeout.

Hi, Ted

My typo on the @param.

TableLockManager.java is marked Private. We can change its API.

Can you explain the problem again?

Would it be better if writeLock() always takes timeout parameter ? When say, value of -1 is passed, we use the default timeout.

The -1 seems to be used to indicate infinite wait.

TableLockManager.java is marked Private. We can change its API.

For Private class, we can change its API / implementation. In this case, the change is to add a parameter to writeLock().

From TableLockManager, line 319:


     * @param writeLockTimeoutMs Timeout (in milliseconds) for acquiring a write lock for a

     * given table, or -1 for no timeout

How about using -2 for default timeout ?

-1 on -2 being 'default timeout'

Patch looks good except for other comments Ted made. Is the patch complete? Does this new method have any users? Does it need to be hooked up?

This message is automatically generated.

Is there really a solid use case for this? Underlying zk based lock implementation provides timeout support at a more granular level, but I've opted out in the TableLockManager level. Why would you obtain a lock with a different timeout?

Enis Soztutar
Thanks for the comment. Yes, the underlying implementation has the perfect support, and I think we should expose it.
It is an easy change, but will be useful for one caller to decide the timeout value without affecting the top level and other components.
Different purpose for locking may warrant different wait timeout.
I am including the change for HBASE-8310 in v3.patch.
I don't want to change the lock acquire timeout for restore or clone snapshot since the semantic should be different:
we can afford and we want to wait. Taking a snapshot is not intended to be really a table operation.
